article.headline: IUPUI 76, Pepperdine 72
article.story: HONOLULU (AP) -- Akeem Clark and Brandon Cole scored 18 points each to lead IUPUI past Pepperdine 76-72 Tuesday night in the third place game of the Rainbow Classic. Blair Crawford added in 14 and Matt Crenshaw had 12 for the Jaguars (7-4) who held off a late rally by Pepperdine (5-8). The Waves were led by Terrance Johnson's 26 points and Alex Acker's 20. Pepperdine had a chance to tie but Chase Griffin's runner in the lane fell short with two seconds left. IUPUI rebounded and Danmorris Harvey sealed the win by making two free throws. Trailing by 12 midway through the second half, Johnson hit three 3-pointers to lead the Pepperdine rally. The Waves cut the lead to one point twice in the half, the last at 71-70 with three minutes left. The Jaguars shot 12-of-23 from 3-point range and was 14-of-20 from the free throw line while the Waves made just five foul shots. The Jaguars were playing without starting guard Odell Bradley who sprained his right ankle in Monday's loss to Hawaii.
